sample.title: Why Retail Brands Are Racing To Open In-Store Coffee Shops
sample.description:
Uniqlo, Coach and luxury brands Louis Vuitton and Dior are opening cafes in their stores. While companies like Capital One and Ralph Lauren began serving coffee over a decade ago, new players are jumping on the trend to draw in more shoppers with experiential offerings. Watch the video to learn more about why these food and beverage establishments are seemingly popping up across the retail landscape.

Chapters:
0:00 Introduction
1:05 Chapter 1: A growing trend
5:12 Chapter 2: Why coffee?
7:30 Chapter 3: Standing out from the crowd

Produced, Shot and Edited by: Ryan Baker
Additional Camera by: Charlotte Morabito
Animation by: Emily Park
Senior Managing Producer: Tala Hadavi
Additional Reporting: Melissa Repko
Additional Footage: Capital One, Coach, Tiffany & Co., Getty Images

sample.title: How Build-a-Bear went from a penny stock to a retail winner
sample.description:
Build-A-Bear Workshop‚Äôs business plummeted during the pandemic, but under CEO Sharon Price John, the company has undergone a significant turnaround.

The toy store, known for its interactive experience of building and accessorizing stuffed animals, has invested in e-commerce, diversified its sales beyond malls and invested in international franchises, boosting its growth.

sample.title: How AI is influencing the Federal Reserve
sample.description:
The Federal Reserve is forecasting relatively strong GDP growth in 2026, attributable to gains in worker productivity.

One long-run economic model indicates that generative AI may have dramatic effects on both labor productivity and employment.

sample.title: Why 'no tax on tips' may be making America's tipping problem worse
sample.description: With tax season approaching, millions of workers could soon claim the "no tax on tips" deduction, which offers a tax break for returns filed in 2026. But some experts question which workers will benefit from the policy.

sample.title: 2025: The year robotaxis went mainstream
sample.description:
Robotaxis felt like science fiction just a decade ago, but this year, autonomous vehicles became a commonplace option for paying passengers across big cities in the U.S. and parts of Asia.

Take a ride with CNBC‚Äôs Lora Kolodny in a Tesla robotaxi.

Watch the full report on the rise of robotaxis in 2025 and why Waymo is leading the way.

sample.title: Under Secretary of State Jacob Helberg on the U.S. AI agenda, securing U.S. supply chain
sample.description: Jacob Helberg, Under Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss the role of the U.S. government in securing the AI supply chain, inside the U.S. AI agenda, and more.

sample.title: Baskaran: Venezuela‚Äôs mines face state control and armed militias
sample.description: Gracelin Baskaran, Director of the Critical Minerals Security Program at CSIS, says Venezuela has major gold and bauxite potential but lacks investment and security, while Greenland holds rare earth promise that will take years to develop.

sample.title: Pethokoukis: The housing crisis is a supply problem, not a private equity problem
sample.description: James Pethokoukis, Economic Policy Analyst at AEI and CNBC Contributor, questions the legality and funding of proposed defense and housing policies, arguing tariffs won‚Äôt cover costs and housing is a supply-driven problem.

sample.title: Branch: This is setting up to be a really good year for markets
sample.description: Greg Branch, Founder and Managing Partner at Branch Global Capital Advisors, says ignore headline noise and focus on long-term tailwinds, with 2026 favoring cyclicals, financials, and minerals over mega-cap AI leaders.

sample.title: Stephanie Link: Palo Alto is poised to grow with expanding margins and demand
sample.description: Stephanie Link, Chief Investment Strategist at Hightower, picks Palo Alto for Q1 2026, calling cybersecurity a decade-long winner as AI drives demand, acquisitions expand offerings, and consolidation accelerates.

sample.title: Iranians rip national flag in protest against economic hardship
sample.description:
Protesters tore an Iranian flag in half in northern Iran, in a video released on January 8, during nationwide demonstrations against economic hardship.

sample.description:
US says it plans to take control of Venezuela's oil production. Kpler oil analyst Naveen Das says that restoring Venezuela's oil infrastructure could cost $10‚Äì15 billion annually for a decade, and firms won't invest without government guarantees.

sample.title: Uniqlo owner Fast Retailing hikes annual forecast on profit surge | REUTERS
sample.description:
Known for durable basic items and considered a bellwether for consumer sentiment in Japan and in China, Uniqlo owner Fast Retailing said operating profit climbed 34% to $1.3 billion during the September-November period on a 15% increase in revenue.

sample.title: US seizes two 'shadow fleet' tankers linked to Venezuelan oil | BBC News
sample.description:
The United States says it has seized two tankers linked to Venezuelan oil exports in "back-to-back" operations in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean.

US forces boarded the Russian-flagged Marinera after a pursuit lasting almost two weeks as it travelled through the waters between Iceland and Scotland. The UK Royal Navy gave logistical support by air and sea.

A second tanker - the M/T Sophia - was accused by the US of "conducting illicit activities" and boarded in the Caribbean.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

#Venezuela #BBCNews

sample.title: People who come off slimming jabs regain weight four times faster than dieters | BBC News
sample.description:
People who come off weight-loss injections such as Mounjaro or Wegovy can regain their lost pounds four times faster than those who stop conventional dieting and exercising, new research suggests.
 
The British Medical Journal has published data which suggests overweight people can shed about a fifth of their body weight when using jabs.
 
But once they quit they regain 0.8 kg every month, on average, meaning they return to their pre-treatment weight in a year-and-a-half.
 
Doctors say more studies of the longer-term effects of new slimming jabs would be helpful.

#BBCNews

sample.title: Protests held in Minneapolis after woman shot dead by US immigration agent | BBC News
sample.description:
A US immigration agent has shot dead a 37-year-old woman in the city of Minneapolis, sparking protests overnight.
 
Federal officials said the woman, Renee Nicole Good, had tried to run over immigration agents with her car but the city mayor said the agent who shot her had acted recklessly.
 
Videos of the incident show ICE agents approaching a car which is in the middle of the street. As it attempts to drive off, one of them points his gun at the driver and at least two shots are heard. The FBI is investigating.
 
Hundreds of ICE agents have been deployed to Minneapolis, in the state of Minnesota, as part of the White House's crackdown on illegal immigration.
